derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a noun): from Old Northern French pouche, variant of Old French poche 'bag'. Compare with poke

encyclopedia.content: pouch KK: [] DJ: [] n.[C] 1. 小袋，囊；烟草袋；钱包 The old man is always carrying a tobacco pouch with him. 这老汉总是随身带着烟袋。 2. 邮袋；弹药袋 3. 【动】育儿袋，肚囊；颊囊 A kangaroo carries its young in a pouch. 大袋鼠以肚袋装小袋鼠。 4. 锛埾卵垌娘級垂肉，眼囊 He has pouches under his eyes. 他的眼睛下面垂着眼袋。 vt. 1. 把。..装入袋中 The mail was sorted and pouched by midnight. 邮件在午

entry.def: A pouch is a flexible container like a small bag.
The pouch of an animal such as a kangaroo or a koala bear is the pocket of skin on its stomach in which its baby grows.

means.word_mean: 1. a small or medium size bag-like container for holding or carrying things

sentences.sentence: "the trapped miners found a pocket of air"

means.word_mean: 3. (anatomy) saclike structure in any of various animals (as a marsupial or gopher or pelican)
2. send by special mail that goes through diplomatic channels
